Room.Name: Edge of the Blight
Room.Description: The air here is much more humid than in the borderland kingdom of Shienar to the south. Each breath is a labor, taxing your strength as you move through the area. Trees still grow here, corrupted and twisted by the Shadow that lays heavily across this cursed land. Decay and disease surrounds you on all sides as you realize youa re far from the Light. To the north you can see what remains Malkeri, swallowed by The Blight, its Seven Towers broken by the hands of The Dark One.

Exit.Description: The remains of the kingdom of Malkeri lie to the north.
The Blight Continues on to the east.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: Entering the Blight
Room.Description: The corrupted tress of the Blight sway in the wind, leaves and branches seeming to grab at you as you pass by them. Your nightmares seem like fanciful daydreams compared to the evil that has seized this land. Only fools and highly-trained Warders enter this far into the Blight, and even the deadly skills of the Warders are sometimes not enough to keep them alive. A little further to the north lie the Towers of Malkeri, surrounded by almost a hundred small lakes.

Exit.Description: The Seven towers lay a few miles ahead, rising like broken hills.
The Blight continues on to the east.
The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: Near the Seven Towers
Room.Description: You stand only a few miles from the Seven Towers of the once great Malkeri. Lakes surround the entire area, their waters dark and cloudy, so dark they seem to swallow the light around them, seeming to reel and bubble moving the shadowy water to small waves. This far into the Blight live creatures that could easily kill a dozen heavily armed Bordermen, creatures created by the Dark One to watch over his land.

Exit.Description: Directly to the north lay the Seven Towers, thier power broken.
The Blight continues on ot the east.
The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: Among the Seven Towers
Room.Description: You now ride along the bases of the Seven Towers, once the kingdom of Malkeri held back the tides of Shadowspan relentlessly seeking to crush the lands to the south. It's power now broken the Towers are in ruins, lying on top of the foothills leading to the Mountains of Dhoom, all but two are utterly destroyed, the two standing towers are to the east and west. The taint of the Shadow is much heavier now, you feel the evil now living in Malkeri. All the trees and plants in this area are only barely holding on, decay taking them as quickly as they grow. Waves roll along the Hundred Lakes, and hope is far away.

Exit.Description: Over the hills to the north the Blight stretches on.
To the east is a breach in one of the Seven Towers walls.
The Blight continues on to the south.
To the west is a breach in one of the Seven Towers' wall.

Room.Name: The Blight
Room.Description: This far north into the Blight shadows scurry everywhere, creatures of the Dark One seeking blood. The trees are now blackened as if dead, but still sway and shiver as you pass. Your stomach curls at the stench of evil in everything here. You wonder if the Dark One is truly bound far to the north in Shayol Ghul...

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the north.
The Blight continues on to the east.
The Seven broken towers now lay behind you to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: Edge of the Blight
Room.Description: The air here is much more humid than in the borderland kingdom of Shienar to the south, each breath is a labor, taxin your strength as you move through the area. Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the north.

The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Description: The corrupted trees of the Blight sway in the wind, leaves and branches seeming to grab at you as you pass by them. Your nightmares seem like fanciful daydreams compared to the evil that has seized this land. Only fools and highly trained Warders enter this far into the Blight, and even the Warders deadly skills are sometimes not enought to keep them alive.

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the north.
The Blight continues on to the east.
The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: The Blight
Room.Description: You are now miles into the Blight. As you search the surrounding area you see the vegetation in this area is almost solid black now. Suddenly you notice one of the trees is not only seeming to move, it _is_ moving - towards you!

Exit.Description: To the north black waters stir with movement.
The Blight continues on to the east.
The Blight continues to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: One of the Hundred Lakes
Room.Description: As you move through the thick oily waters of the lake you wonder what evil creatures live in this slime. Movement stirs on all sides of you, and you come face to face with one of it's denizens...

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the north.
The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

ExtraDescription.Description: The lake is obviously full of poisoned waters, you wonder if it is wise to be swimming in it like this. Along the shore your feet drag through the muck. Your feel your boot strike something hard...

Room.Description: You have stumbled across a scouting party of Trollocs. A small fire burns in the center of the camp. They appear to be preparing to enjoy a Trolloc delicacy, your stomach wrenches as you realize what they are devouring. They turn about sensing an intrusion of thier meal...

Room.Name: The Blight
Room.Description: A dark cloud blots out what little light reaches this stretch of land in the far north of the Blight. You survey the surrounding countryside as you decide your next course of travel as the cloud moves closer to your location. The sound of a thousand wings fill your ears as your realize in horror that the cloud is actually a huge flock of raven. The Eyes of the Dark One descend upon you to rend your flesh and spirit.

Room.Description: The corrupted trees of the Blight sway in the wind, leaves and branches seeming to grab at you as you pass by them. Your nightmares seem like fanciful daydreams compared to the evil that has siezed this land. Only fools and highly trained Warders enter this far into the Blight, and even the Warders deadly skills are sometimes not enough to keep them alive.

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the north.
The Blight continues on to the east.
The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: The Blight
Room.Description: This far north into the Blight shadows scurry everywhere, creatures of the Dark One seeking blood. The trees are now blackened as if dead, but still sway and shiver as you pass. Your stomach curls at the stench of evil in everything here. You wonder if the Dark One is truly bound far to the north in Shayol Ghul...

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the north.
The Blight continues on to the east.
The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: The Blight
Room.Description: This far north into the Blight shadows scurry everywhere, creatures of the Dark One seeking blood. The trees are now blackened as if dead, but still sway and shiver as you pass. Your stomach curls at the stench of evil in everything here. You wonder if the Dark One is truly bound far to the north in Shayol Ghul...

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the north.
The Blight continues on to the east.
The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: The Blight
Room.Description: This area of the Blight seems like all the others at first, death and disease reigning everywhere. Then you notice a small outcrop of rock that seems out of place. Upon closer inspection you realize it is man made, appearantly the top of a tower, now buried deep in the earth. What lost kingdom must this have belonged to?

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the north.
The Blight continues on to the east.
The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.
The air here seems shimmer as you gaze downward.

Room.Name: Into the Breach
Room.Description: You have entered into a breach in the wall of one of the Seven Towers, Trolloc armies over ran this tower many years ago. To the east lies a hallway deeper into the tower. The Blight is outside to the west. You doubt the Trolloc armies, and any creatures here since left anything in the tower, except the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the east.
The Blight lies to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the main floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading up into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the east.

Exit.Description: The hallway continues to the east.
A set of stairs lies to the south.
A breach in the tower wall is west from here.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the center of the hallway on the main floor of the tower. You see the remains of Trollocs and men lying about this ruined tower. Many died here trying to defend Malkeri, and many more died taking the tower. To the north you see a wide set of stable doors, to the south you see a set what remains of another set of doors. The hallway continues to the east and west.

Exit.Description: The stables lie to the north.
The hallway continues to the east.
A large yard lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the main floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading down into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the west.

Exit.Description: A set of stairs lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads up into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
The stairs lead up to the second floor.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads down into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads down into the tower.

Room.Name: The Stables
Room.Description: Although you can tell this was a stables at one time from the stalls and the rotted leather of old tack and harnesses, the smell here is not of horses, but of death, and dust. No one has used this room as a stables for a very long time, all the stalls are empty, and whatever grain may have been stored here as feed has long since rotted away. The only exit from this room is to the south, back into the hallway.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Main Yard
Room.Description: Here is where the soldiers of this tower would gather before going on a patrol, before the tower was swallowed by the blight. It appears it is also where they made thier last stand against the Trolloc invaders. The skeletons of humans and Trollocs alike litter the floor. You notice with respect that the Malkeri must have killed three Trollocs for every man that died after a quick survey of the skeletons.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
The smashed remains of a once stout door lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Gatehouse
Room.Description: You have entered the gatehouse of the tower, the soldiers must have fallen back to this room when they had been weakened by the Trolloc hordes that crushed them in the room to the north. You eye what was once an stout wooden door, reinforced with iron bars, smashed now into kindling. To the east and west are two small doors, probably guard rooms, while to the south you see a massive iron portcullis, still intact, and rusted completely shut, it's opening mechanism either destroyed by the defenders of the tower, or possibly it's attackers...

Exit.Description: A large yard lies to the north.
A small door lies to the east.
A small door leads to the west.

Room.Name: A Guard Room
Room.Description: You have entered a guard room, this was once used to house the gate guards during the night, keeping part of the guards at the gate, while others slept here for quick reinforcements. No one must have been in this room when the tower fell, and it is one of the least destroyed rooms in the building. A few beds and chests line the walls undisturbed.

Exit.Description: A small door lies to the east.

Room.Name: A Guard Room
Room.Description: You have entered a guard room, this was once used to house the gate guards during the night, keeping part of the guards at the gate, while others slept here for quick reinforcements. No one must have been in this room when the tower fell, and it is one of the least destroyed rooms in the building. A few beds and chests line the walls undisturbed.

Exit.Description: A small door lies to the west.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads down into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads down into the tower.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the second floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading down into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the east.

Exit.Description: The hallway continues to the east.
A set of stairs lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the center of the hallway on the main floor of the tower. You see the remains of Trollocs and men lying about this ruined tower. Many died here trying to defend Malkeri, and many more died taking the tower. To the north is a wide archway leading into darkness, to the south is another darkened room, and the hallway continues to the east and west.

Exit.Description: A darkened room lies to the north.
The hallway continues to the east.
A darkened room lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the second floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading up into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the west.

Exit.Description: A set of stairs lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads up into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads up into the tower.

Room.Name: The Kitchen
Room.Description: This was kitchen for the people of this tower. Splintered tables and broken and dented pots and pans lay about the room. Off to the south is a hallway, while a door to the east leads into another room of the tower.

Exit.Description: A small door is here.
A hallway lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Larder
Room.Description: This was the larder for the kitchen, you notice a human skeleton hanging from one of the meat hooks that once held fleshly staughtered beef when the towers kitchens prepared food for it's inhabitants. All the food has long since gone rotten in the larder, leaving nothing for the rats and other inhabitants of this once proud tower.

Exit.Description: The towers kitchens lie to the west.

Room.Name: Dining Hall
Room.Description: This is where the soldiers and servants of the tower took thier meals. All the tables and chairs in the room are broken and scattered about the room, you have the feeling that the last meal in this room was it's usual patrons, eaten by the Trolloc armies that defeated the tower.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads down into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads down into the tower.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the third floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. On the northern wall a door leads off into the tower. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading down into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the west.

Exit.Description: A door leads off into the tower.
A set of stairs lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the center of the hallway on the main floor of the tower. You see the remains of Trollocs and men lying about this ruined tower. Many died here trying to defend Malkeri, and many more died taking the tower. To the south a door leads off into the darkness, and the hallway continues to the east and west.

Exit.Description: The hallway continues to the east.
A door stands in the southern wall.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the center of the hallway on the main floor of the tower. You see the remains of Trollocs and men lying about this ruined tower. Many died here trying to defend Malkeri, and many more died taking the tower. To the north and south doorways lead off into the darkness, and the hallway continues to the east and west.

Exit.Description: A door leads off into the tower to the north.
The hallway continues to the east.
A door leads off into the tower to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the third floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading up into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the east.

Exit.Description: The hallway continues to the east.
A set of stairs can be seen to the south.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads up into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads up into the tower.

Room.Name: The Barracks
Room.Description: This is were the soldiers of the tower made thier home while in the service of the Tower's Lord. The floor is covered with the rubble of old furnishings and the occasional skeleton. Looking more closely at a section of the northern wall you notice a small patch of writing that reads "Lies, lies - where is the power I was promised?"

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the south.

Room.Name: Servant's Quarters
Room.Description: This room used to house the servants of the tower, now only a rat or two lives in thier places. The room is bare except for rotting pallets bare of any padding, and the skeletons of the long dead servants themselves.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the south.

Room.Name: Officer's Quarters
Room.Description: This room is in amazingly good shape, appearantly these men were not in thier quarters when the final assault took place. You can see that the room held four men. Bunks and lockers are in each corner of the room, disturbed, but not destroyed.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.

Room.Name: Captain's Quarters
Room.Description: This room has been almost destroyed. Nothing remains that has not been broken apart or totally destroyed. The Trollocs seem to have been searching this room, although for what, or if they found it is a mystery...

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads down into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads down into the tower.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the top floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading down into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the east.

Exit.Description: The hallway continues to the east.
A set of stairs can be seen to the south.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the center of the hallway on the main floor of the tower. You see the remains of Trollocs and men lying about this ruined tower. Many died here trying to defend Malkeri, and many more died taking the tower. To the north is a wide archway leading into darkness, to the south a large gilded door stands seemingly untouched by the towers fall, the hallway continues to the east and west.

Exit.Description: An archway leads into another part of the tower.
The hallway continues to the east.
A large gilded door stands to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the top floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading up yo the roof of the tower. While the hallway continues back to the west.

Exit.Description: A set of stairs can be seen to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads up onto the battlements of the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
The battlements of the tower lie above you.

Room.Name: The Feast Hall
Room.Description: This room was meant to hold victory celebrations and welcome important guests, used by the Lord of the tower and soldiers alike. It now lies in ruins as much of the rest of the tower. Banners of depicting great battles and fanciful creatures and places once lined it's walls, now it walls are lined with dried blood and grey rags. Once, this tower was one of the Seven Towers of Malkeri, now a ruin in the Blight.

Exit.Description: An archway leads into darkness to the south.

Room.Name: The Lord's Quarters
Room.Description: The Lord of the tower lived here, and in a fashion still does, the room is immaculate, it's furnishings still intact, and banners as colorful as if newly woven. A large bed is made in the middle of the room. The air seems to shiver with life and anger at someone daring to enter this room. The air becomes clearer, as does a shape forming beside the bed. Malkerians were ever a stubborn lot.

Exit.Description: A great gilded door lies to the north.

Room.Name: The Battlements
Room.Description: You stand atop one of the Seven Towers of the lost kingdom of Malkeri. Once this tower overlooked farms and houses of the Malkerians, now it overlooks the desolation of the Blight, the Land of the Shadow. The battlements themselves are blackened as if by huge gouts of fire, your heart sinks with desperation and a sense of loss for the broken kingdom, and it's brave people.

Exit.Description: Below you stairs lead down into the tower.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads up into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads up into the tower.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway in the basement of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading up into the tower. To the north you see a door adorned with two crossed swords, now covered in blood. The hallway continues to the west.

Exit.Description: A door adorned with crossed swords, now fouled with blood is to the north.
A set of stairs lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: By the Shore
Room.Description: A grotesque and disturbing site meets you eyes here. The Blight still surrounds you all of it's death and decay strong in your mind. But, what lies to the west is perhaps the most disturbing of all. You are standing on the shore of the Dead Sea. It's black and lifeless waters are perfectly still like a huge mirror of pollished obsidian. It's calm and lack of life chill you to the bone, surely one step into those evil waters would mean your death.

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the north.
The Blight continues on to the east.
The Borderland kingdom of Saldaea lies to the south.

Room.Name: In the Borderlands
Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Saldaea. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet you every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches northward.
The border continues to the east.

Room.Name: In the Borderlands
Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Saldaea. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet you every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches northward.
The border continues to the east.
The border continues to the west.

Room.Name: In the Borderlands
Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Saldaea. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet you every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches northward.
The border continues to the east.
The border continues ot the west.

Room.Name: In the Borderlands
Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Saldaea. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet you every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches northward.
The border continues to the east.
The border continues to the west.

Room.Name: In the Borderlands
Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Kandor. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet you every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches northward.
The border continues to the east.
The border continues to the west.

Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Kandor. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet you every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches northward.
The border continues ot the east.
The border continues ot the west.

Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Kandor. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet you every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches northward.
The border continues to the east.
The border continues to the west.

Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Arafel. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet you every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight strecthes northward.
The border continues to the east.
The border continues to the west.

Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Arafel. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet you every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches northward.
The border continues to the east.
The border continues to the west.

Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Arafel. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet you every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches northward.
The border continues to the east.
The border continues to the west.

Room.Name: In the Borderlands
Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Shienar. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet you every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches northward.
The border continues to the east.
The border continues to the west.

Room.Name: In the Borderlands
Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Shienar. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet you every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches northward.
The border continues to the east.
The border continues to the west.

Room.Name: In the Borderlands
Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Shienar. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet you every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches northward.
The border continues to the east.
The border continues to the west.

Room.Name: In the Borderlands
Room.Description: You are just north of the borderland kingdom of Shienar. It is one of the four kingdom that hold back the Dark One's Shadowspawn from the rest of the world. They are a good people, but allow no one and nothing from the Blight to pass into thier lands, patrols meet your every effort to move farther south, turning you back with suspicious eyes.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches northward.
The border continues to the west.

Room.Name: A Warded Glade
Room.Description: You didn't even see this area from the south! It is not a lucious garden, but then again, there are actually some green plants here, as well as a spring flowing with appearantly untainted water. You can now see the ancient looking wards suroounding the glade. Perhaps they were laid buy Lews Therin himself or one of the Hundred Companions. Whoever did it, you are just happy to be here, safe from the horrors of the Blight.

Exit.Description: The Blight stretches on to the south.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the center of the hallway in the basment of the tower. You see the remains of Trollocs and men lying about this ruined tower. Many died here trying to defend Malkeri, and many more died taking the tower. To the south you see a sturdy set of doors leading off to another section of the tower, while the hallway continues to the east and west.

Exit.Description: The hallway continues to the east.
A large sturdy door stands in the southern wall.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway in the basement of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading down into the tower. A small door is set in the northern wall, and, the hallway continues to the east.

Exit.Description: A small door is set in the northern wall.
The hallway continues to the east.
A set of stairs lies to the south.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads down into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads down into the tower.

Room.Name: Water Storage
Room.Description: Here is where the water for the tower was stored, appearantly gathered fro one of the Hundred Lakes. The water in the tank is no fouled like the water in the lakes themselves. A door leads back into the hallway to the south, while to the west you see a small duct, possibly leading back outside to one of the lakes.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the south.
A small duct leads into one of the Hundred Lakes.

Room.Name: The Training Room
Room.Description: Long ago, the finest warriors in the borderlands practiced thier skills in this room, shattered remnants of weapons, and a few skeletons are all that remains. Through the blood and wreckage of this room, a slogan is painted all across the northern wall, 'May peace favor your sword.' A dream for these long dead warriors. One that never came to be...

Exit.Description: The Hallway is south from here.

Room.Name: The Armoury
Room.Description: Yoou have come across the towers armoury. If you could repair what is left in this shattered room, you could equip a small army. Unfourtunately, the Trolloc hordes that fell this mighty tower were very thorough in thier destruction. All that is left is twisted metal and splintered wood among the rotting leather.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads up into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads up into the tower.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the dungeons of the tower. There are now banners here to adorn the walls. This was no a place of honor or celebration in the tower, and dried blood is the only decorations to be seen on it's walls. A stout door isset into northern wall. To the south lies a set of stairs, while the hallway continues to the east.

Exit.Description: A stout door is set in the northern wall.
The hallway continues to the east.
A set of stairs lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the dungeons of the tower. There are no banners here to adorn the walls. This was no a place of honor or celebration in the tower, and dried blood is the only decorations to be seen on it's walls. A barred door is set in the southern wall, the hallway continues to the west.

Exit.Description: A stout door is set in the southern wall.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: Guard Room
Room.Description: The dungeon's guards once kept thier watch from this room. There are no longer prisonners to watch, or guards to watch them however, and this room holds nothing but wreckage and dust. A small door is set in the eastern wall, while the hallway lies to the south.

Exit.Description: A small door lies to the east.
A stout door is set in the southern wall.

Room.Name: Interogation Room
Room.Description: This is were the prisonners of the tower were questioned. Although you do not see any implements of torture in this room, you feel certain the towers guards had many questions answered here. A small door leads into the guard room to the west.

Exit.Description: A small door is set into the western wall.

Room.Name: The Cells
Room.Description: Although no one resides here any longer, you feel a sense of despair. As you look around the area you notice that although the tower was taken, and that this area was surely checked, that none of the cells stand open. Two of the cells hold skeletons hanging from rotting ropes appearantly made from rotting bedding. Surely the Shadowspawn that took the tower would have freed thier fellows. Wouldn't they?

Exit.Description: A stout door is set in the northern wall.

Room.Name: Into the Breach
Room.Description: You have entered into a breach in the wall of one of the Seven Towers, Trolloc armies over ran this tower many years ago. To the west lies a hallway deeper into the tower. The Blight is outside to the east. You doubt the Trolloc armies, and any creatures here since left anything in the tower, except the dead.

Exit.Description: The Blight lies outside to the east.
A hallway lies to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the main floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading down into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the west. To the east you see a great breach in the towers walls.

Exit.Description: There is a breach in the tower's wall to the east.
A set of stairs lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads down into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads down into the tower.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the center of the hallway on the main floor of the tower. You see the remains of Trollocs and men lying about this ruined tower. Many died here trying to defend Malkeri, and many more died taking the tower. To the north you see a wide set of stable doors, to the south you see a set what remains of another set of doors. The hallway continues to the east and west.

Exit.Description: The stables lie to the north.
The hallway continues to the east.
A large yard lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the main floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading up into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the east.

Exit.Description: The hallway continues to the east.
A set of stairs lies to the south.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads up into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads up into the tower.

Room.Name: The Stables
Room.Description: Although you can tell this was a stables at one time from the stalls and the rotted leather of old tack and harnesses, the smell here is not of horses, but of death, and dust. No one has used this room as a stables for a very long time, all the stalls are empty, and whatever grain may have been stored here as feed has long since rotted away. The only exit from this room is to the south, back into the hallway.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Main Yard
Room.Description: Here is where the soldiers of this tower would gather before going on a patrol, before the tower was swallowed by the blight. It appears it is also where they made thier last stand against the Trolloc invaders. The skeletons of humans and Trollocs alike litter the floor. You notice with respect that the Malkeri must have killed three Trollocs for every man that died after a quick survey of the skeletons.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A gatehouse can be seen to the south.

Room.Name: The Gatehouse
Room.Description: You have entered the gatehouse of the tower, the soldiers must have fallen back to this room when they had been weakened by the Trolloc hordes that hard crushed them in the room to the north. You eye what was once an stout wooden door, reinforced with iron bars, smashed now into kindling. To the east and west are two small doors, probably guard rooms, while to the south you see a massive iron portcullis, still intact, and rusted completely shut, it's opening mechanism either destroyed by the defenders of the tower, or possibly it's attackers...

Exit.Description: A large yard lies to the north.
A small door lies to the east.
A small door lies to the west.

Room.Name: A Guard Room
Room.Description: You have entered a guard room, this was once used to house the gate guards during the night, keeping part of the guards at the gate, while others slept here for quick reinforcements. No one must have been in this room when the tower fell, and it is one of the least destroyed rooms in the building. A few beds and chests line the walls undisturbed.

Exit.Description: A small door lies to the east.

Room.Name: A Guard Room
Room.Description: You have entered a guard room, this was once used to house the gate guards during the night, keeping part of the guards at the gate, while others slept here for quick reinforcements. No one must have been in this room when the tower fell, and it is one of the least destroyed rooms in the building. A few beds and chests line the walls undisturbed.

Exit.Description: A small door lies to the west.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads down into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads down into the tower.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the second floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading down into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the east.

Exit.Description: The hallway continues to the east.
A set of stairs lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the center of the hallway on the main floor of the tower. You see the remains of Trollocs and men lying about this ruined tower. Many died here trying to defend Malkeri, and many more died taking the tower. To the north is a wide archway leading into darkness, to the south is another darkened room, and the hallway continues to the east and west.

Exit.Description: A darkened room lies to the north.
The hallway continues to the east.
A darkened room lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the second floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading up into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the west.

Exit.Description: A set of stairs lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads up into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads up into the tower.

Room.Name: The Kitchen
Room.Description: This was kitchen for the people of this tower. Splintered tables and broken and dented pots and pans lay about the room. Off to the south is a hallway, while a door to the east leads into another room of the tower.

Exit.Description: A small door lies to the east.
A hallway lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Larder
Room.Description: This was the larder for the kitchen, you notice a human skeleton hanging from one of the meat hooks that once held fleshly staughtered beef when the towers kitchens prepared food for it's inhabitants. All the food has long since gone rotten in the larder, leaving nothing for the rats and other inhabitants of this once proud tower.

Exit.Description: The tower's kitchen lies to the west.

Room.Name: Dining Hall
Room.Description: This is where the soldiers and servants of the tower took thier meals. All the tables and chairs in the room are broken and scattered about the room, you have the feeling that the last meal in this room was it's usual patrons, eaten by the Trolloc armies that defeated the tower.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads down into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads down into the tower.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the third floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. On the northern wall a door leads off into the tower. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading down into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the west.

Exit.Description: A small door lies to the north.
A set of stairs lies to the south.
The hallway continues on to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the center of the hallway on the main floor of the tower. You see the remains of Trollocs and men lying about this ruined tower. Many died here trying to defend Malkeri, and many more died taking the tower. To the south a door leads off into the darkness, and the hallway continues to the east and west.

Exit.Description: The hallway continues to the east.
A small door lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the center of the hallway on the main floor of the tower. You see the remains of Trollocs and men lying about this ruined tower. Many died here trying to defend Malkeri, and many more died taking the tower. To the north and south doorways lead off into the darkness, and the hallway continues to the east and west.

Exit.Description: A large door stands in the northern wall.
The hallway continues to the east.
A door lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the third floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading up into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the east.

Exit.Description: The hallway continues to the east.
A set of stairs lies to the south.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads up into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads up into the tower.

Room.Name: The Barracks
Room.Description: This is were the soldiers of the tower made thier home while in the service of the Tower's Lord. The floor is covered with the rubble of old furnishings and the occasional skeleton. Looking more closely at a section of the northern wall you notice a small patch of writing that reads "I should have taken the Dark One's offer, I could have power now instead of death."

Exit.Description: A large door lies to the south.

Room.Name: Servant's Quarters
Room.Description: This room used to house the servants of the tower, now only a rat or two lives in thier places. The room is bare except for rotting pallets bare of any padding, and the skeletons of the long dead servants themselves.

Exit.Description: A small door lies to the south.

Room.Name: Officer's Quarters
Room.Description: This room is in amazingly good shape, appearantly these men were not in thier quarters when the final assault took place. You can see that the room held four men. Bunks and lockers are in each corner of the room, disturbed, but not destroyed.

Exit.Description: A door lies to the north.

Room.Name: Captain's Quarters
Room.Description: This room has been almost destroyed. Nothing remains that has not been broken apart or totally destroyed. The Trollocs seem to have been searching this room, although for what, or if they found it is a mystery...

Exit.Description: A small door lies to the north.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads down into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads down into the tower.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the top floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading down into the tower. And, the hallway continues to the east.

Exit.Description: The hallway continues to the east.
A set of stairs lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the center of the hallway on the main floor of the tower. You see the remains of Trollocs and men lying about this ruined tower. Many died here trying to defend Malkeri, and many more died taking the tower. To the north is a wide archway leading into darkness, to the south a large gilded door stands seemingly untouched by the towers fall, the hallway continues to the east and west.

Exit.Description: An archway leads into another part of the tower.
The hallway continues to the east.
A large gilded door lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway on the top floor of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading up yo the roof of the tower. While the hallway continues back to the west.

Exit.Description: A set of stairs lies to the south.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads up onto the battlements of the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads up to the tower's battlements.

Room.Name: The Feast Hall
Room.Description: This room was meant to hold victory celebrations and welcome important guests, used by the Lord of the tower and soldiers alike. It now lies in ruins as much of the rest of the tower. Banners of depicting great battles and fanciful creatures and places once lined it's walls, now it walls are lined with dried blood and grey rags. Once, this tower was one of the Seven Towers of Malkeri, now a ruin in the Blight.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Lord's Quarters
Room.Description: The Lord of the tower lived here, and in a fashion still does, the room is immaculate, it's furnishings still intact, and banners as colorful as if newly woven. A large bed is made in the middle of the room. The air seems to shiver with life and anger at someone daring to enter this room. The air becomes clearer, as does a shape forming beside the bed. Malkerians were ever a stubborn lot.

Exit.Description: A large golden door is set in the northern wall.

Room.Name: The Battlements
Room.Description: You stand atop one of the Seven Towers of the lost kingdom of Malkeri. Once this tower overlooked farms and houses of the Malkerians, now it overlooks the desolation of the Blight, the Land of the Shadow. The battlements themselves are blackened as if by huge gouts of fire, your heart sinks with desperation and a sense of loss for the broken kingdom, and it's brave people.

Exit.Description: A set of stairs leads down into the tower.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads up into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads up into the tower.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway in the basement of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading up into the tower. To the north you see a door adorned with two crossed swords, now covered in blood. The hallway continues to the west.

Exit.Description: A set of doors adorned with crossed swords lies to the north.
A Stairwell is south from here.
The hallway continues to west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the center of the hallway in the basment of the tower. You see the remains of Trollocs and men lying about this ruined tower. Many died here trying to defend Malkeri, and many more died taking the tower. To the south you see a sturdy set of doors leading off to another section of the tower, while the hallway continues to the east and west.

Exit.Description: The hallway continues to the east.
A stout door is set in the southern wall.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in a hallway in the basement of the tower. Faded banners and black streaks of dried blood line the walls. A set of stairs can be seen off to the south leading down into the tower. A small door is set in the northern wall, and, the hallway continues to the east.

Exit.Description: A small door lies to the north.
The hallway continues to the east.
A set of stairs lies to the south.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads down into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads down into the tower.

Room.Name: Water Storage
Room.Description: Here is where the water for the tower was stored, appearantly gathered fro one of the Hundred Lakes. The water in the tank is no fouled like the water in the lakes themselves. A door leads back into the hallway to the south, while to the west you see a small duct, possibly leading back outside to one of the lakes.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the south.
A duct leads to on of the Hundred Lakes.

Room.Name: The Training Room
Room.Description: Long ago, the finest warriors in the borderlands practiced thier skills in this room, shattered remnants of weapons, and a few skeletons are all that remains. Through the blood and wreckage of this room, a slogan is painted all across the northern wall, 'May peace favor your sword.' A dream for these long dead warriors. One that never came to be...

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Armoury
Room.Description: Yoou have come across the towers armoury. If you could repair what is left in this shattered room, you could equip a small army. Unfourtunately, the Trolloc hordes that fell this mighty tower were very thorough in thier destruction. All that is left is twisted metal and splintered wood among the rotting leather.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.

Room.Name: A Stairwell
Room.Description: Now well into the tower the light has faltered, as you weave your way through the oppressive darkness of the tower. Here a stairway leads up into the tower. The walls are still streaked with blood, and the occasional Trolloc symbols written in the blood of the dead.

Exit.Description: A hallway lies to the north.
A set of stairs leads up into the tower.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the dungeons of the tower. There are now banners here to adorn the walls. This was no a place of honor or celebration in the tower, and dried blood is the only decorations to be seen on it's walls. A stout door isset into northern wall. To the south lies a set of stairs, while the hallway continues to the east.

Exit.Description: A stout door is set in the northern wall.
The hallway continues to the west.
A set of stairs lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: You are now in the dungeons of the tower. There are no banners here to adorn the walls. This was no a place of honor or celebration in the tower, and dried blood is the only decorations to be seen on it's walls. A barred door is set in the southern wall, the hallway continues to the west.

Exit.Description: A stout door is set in the southern wall.
The hallway continues to the west.

Room.Name: Guard Room
Room.Description: The dungeon's guards once kept thier watch from this room. There are no longer prisonners to watch, or guards to watch them however, and this room holds nothing but wreckage and dust. A small door is set in the eastern wall, while the hallway lies to the south.

Exit.Description: A door lies to the east.
A hallway lies to the south.

Room.Name: Interogation Room
Room.Description: This is were the prisonners of the tower were questioned. Although you do not see any implements of torture in this room, you feel certain the towers guards had many questions answered here. A small door leads into the guard room to the west.

Exit.Description: A door lies to the west.

Room.Name: The Cells
Room.Description: Although no one resides here any longer, you feel a sense of despair. As you look around the area you notice that although the tower was taken, and that this area was surely checked, that none of the cells stand open. Two of the cells hold skeletons hanging from rotting ropes appearantly made from rotting bedding. Surely the Shadowspawn that took the tower would have freed thier fellows. Wouldn't they?

Exit.Description: A stout door is set in the northern wall.

Room.Name: Into the Past
Room.Description: You forge your way down into the tower, but this is not what you expected, the air is shimmering, and you feel disoriented. You are not in a room, it's more like you are floating, existing, nothing more. You feel your self slipping away, and know you must move from this area soon, or be lost forever.

Exit.Description: You cannot pierce the shimmering air.
You cannot pierce the shimmering air.
You cannot pierce the shimmering air.
You cannot pierce the shimmering air.
You sense a great evil above you.
Things seem clearer downward.

Room.Name: Foxes and Snakes
Room.Description: Your mind is still foggy, but a memory of a childhood game struggles to the surface. Foxes and Snakes. A childhood game more complex than, but not unlike hunting snipes, as you survey the scene you realize why. You are suspeneded in mid-air by some unseen force, all around you pale humanoids observe you grinning with canine maws. They are too tall to be humans, and too thin. You are glad that whatever force keeps you from moving on stops them from getting to you also.

Exit.Description: The air is still shimmering to the south.

Room.Name: Foxes and Snakes
Room.Description: Your mind is still foggy, but a memory of a childhood game struggles to the surface. Foxes and Snakes. A childhood game more complex than, but not unlike hunting snipes, as you survey the scene you realize why. You are suspeneded in mid-air by some unseen force, all around you scaled humanoids are observing you. They seem to have no bones as they sway like willows in the wind. They seem to be in rapture at your presence, smiling absently. You are glad that whatever force keeps you from moving on stops them from getting to you also.

Exit.Description: The air is still shimmering to the north.

Room.Name: The Writing Room
Room.Description: You have entered into a large comfortable room. Still a bit disoriented, it takes you a moment to realize there is a man sitting at a desk by a warm looking fireplace. You feel quite strange. The man is oblivious to you, and you are unable to enter further into the room. You have never seen the man before, but you sense he is a man great power. The kind who contols other men and women fates with uncommon ease, sitting before a glowing screen, working some strange plate before him.

Exit.Description: The air is still shimmering to the east.

Room.Name: A Strange Room
Room.Description: You are awed by what you see before you, and a little confused. Lighted boxes line a large room. Lights of all colors blink on the boxes, two men sit at a table on the far side of the room. They do not notice you, and you cannot seem to get thier attention. More importantly, as you look at some of the windows in the room, you see great battles taking place, people you know talking back in the town you come from, people living and dying, being reborn, and dying again. And the men in the room don't even notice! You feel a great need to leave this place.

Exit.Description: The air still shimmers to the west.

Room.Name: The Center
Room.Description: You are in the center of a large yard. Around the yard people dressed in strange clothes move about. Some of them look at you for a moment and move on, others do not even notice you and move by the glass surrounding you without a care. Other beings are in the glass yard with you...

Exit.Description: The Northern Yard
The Eastern Yard
The Southern Yard
The Western Yard
The air is shimmering directly above you.

Room.Name: The Southern Yard
Room.Description: You are in the middle of the southern wall of this strange yard. The wall appears to be made of glass, but when you test it's strength you find it harder than steel. The people outside sometimes look at you with a sense of wonder, sometimes disgust, and sometines not at all. The other beings in the yard look as confused as you feel.

Exit.Description: The center of the yard is to the north.
The southeast corner of the yard is to the east.
The southwest corner of the yard is to the west.

Room.Name: The Southeast Corner
Room.Description: You stand in the southeast corner of this strange yard. The wall surrounding the yard looks like glass, but when you test it's strength you find it to be harder than steel. People milling around outside sometimes notice you, sometimes not. The other beings in the yard look as confused as you feel.

Exit.Description: The eastern wall of the yard is to the north.
The southern wall of the yard is to the west.

Room.Name: The Eastern Yard
Room.Description: You are in the middle of the eastern wall of this strange yard. The wall appears to be made of glass, but when you test it's strength you find it harder than steel. The people outside sometimes look at you with a sense of wonder, sometimes disgust, and sometines not at all. The other beings in the yard look as confused as you feel.

Exit.Description: The northeast corner of the yard is to the north.
The southeast corner of the yard is to the south.
The center of the yard is to the west.

Room.Name: The Northeast Corner
Room.Description: You stand in the northeast corner of this strange yard. The wall surrounding the yard looks like glass, but when you test it's strength you find it to be harder than steel. People milling around outside sometimes notice you, sometimes not. The other beings in the yard look as confused as you feel.

Exit.Description: The east wall of the yard is to the south.
The north wall of the yard is to the west.

Room.Name: The Northern Yard
Room.Description: You are in the middle of the northern wall of this strange yard. The wall appears to be made of glass, but when you test it's strength you find it harder than steel. The people outside sometimes look at you with a sense of wonder, sometimes disgust, and sometines not at all. The other beings in the yard look as confused as you feel.

Exit.Description: The northeast corner of the yard is to the east.
The center of the yard is to the south.
The northwest corner of the yard is to the west.

Room.Name: The Northwest Corner
Room.Description: You stand in the northwest corner of this strange yard. The wall surrounding the yard looks like glass, but when you test it's strength you find it to be harder than steel. People milling around outside sometimes notice you, sometimes not. The other beings in the yard look as confused as you feel.

Exit.Description: The north wall of the yard is to the east.
The west wall of the yard is the south.

Room.Name: The Western Yard
Room.Description: You are in the middle of the western wall of this strange yard. The wall appears to be made of glass, but when you test it's strength you find it harder than steel. The people outside sometimes look at you with a sense of wonder, sometimes disgust, and sometines not at all. The other beings in the yard look as confused as you feel.

Exit.Description: The northwest corner of the yard is to the north.
The center of the yard is to the east.
The southwest corner of the yard is to the south.

Room.Name: The Southwest Corner
Room.Description: You stand in the southwest corner of this strange yard. The wall surrounding the yard looks like glass, but when you test it's strength you find it to be harder than steel. People milling around outside sometimes notice you, sometimes not. The other beings in the yard look as confused as you feel.

Exit.Description: The west wall of the yard is to the north.
The south wall of the yard is to the east.

Room.Name: Near The Spine of the World
Room.Description: You have travelled east all the way to the Spine of the World. It's mountains loom above you to the east leaving you no further path to the east. Legend has it that the mighty Aiel live on the other side of the Dragonwall, and you think maybe it's best that you cannot continue in that direction. You still need to survive the Blight.

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the north.
The borderland kingdom of Shienar lies ot he south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: Near The Spine of the World
Room.Description: You have travelled east all the way to the Spine of the World. It's mountains loom above you to the east leaving you no further path to the east. Legend has it that the mighty Aiel live on the other side of the Dragonwall, and you think maybe it's best that you cannot continue in that direction. You still need to survive the Blight.

Exit.Description: The Blight Continues on to the north.
The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: Near The Spine of the World
Room.Description: You have travelled east all the way to the Spine of the World. It's mountains loom above you to the east leaving you no further path to the east. Legend has it that the mighty Aiel live on the other side of the Dragonwall, and you think maybe it's best that you cannot continue in that direction. You still need to survive the Blight.

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the north.
The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: Near The Spine of the World
Room.Description: You have travelled east all the way to the Spine of the World. It's mountains loom above you to the east leaving you no further path to the east. Legend has it that the mighty Aiel live on the other side of the Dragonwall, and you think maybe it's best that you cannot continue in that direction. You still need to survive the Blight.

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the north.
The Blight continues on to the south.

Room.Name: Near The Spine of the World
Room.Description: You have travelled east all the way to the Spine of the World. It's mountains loom above you to the east leaving you no further path to the east. Legend has it that the mighty Aiel live on the other side of the Dragonwall, and you think maybe it's best that you cannot continue in that direction. You still need to survive the Blight.

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the north.
The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: Tarwin's Gap
Room.Description: You have reached the beginning of Tarwin's Gap. The largest pass in the Mountains of Dhoom. Many great battles have taken place in this gap. Traditionally the Malkerians defended this gap. Once that that kingdom fell the duty fell to the borderland kingdom of Shienar. You see more than a fist of Trollocs camped in the gap. Going further to the north would be suicide. With the Dragonwall to the east, and the Mountains of Dhoom to the north, you must turn back.

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: Near the Mountains of Dhoom
Room.Description: You stand at the base of the Mountains of Dhoom. If things are this bad hundreds of miles from Shayol Ghul, you shiver at what the Blasted Lands to the north of the range must be like, fully in the embrace of Ba'alzamon.

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the east.
The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: Near the Mountains of Dhoom
Room.Description: You stand at the base of the Mountains of Dhoom. If things are this bad hundreds of miles from Shayol Ghul, you shiver at what the Blasted Lands to the north of the range must be like, fully in the embrace of Ba'alzamon. You can see a small pass to the north into the range.

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the east.
The Blight continues on to the south.
The Blight continues on to the west.

Room.Name: The Moutains and the Sea
Room.Description: A grotesque and disturbing site meets you eyes here. The Blight continues on to the south and east with all of it's death and decay strong in your mind. To the north lay the Mountains of Dhoom, that few men have travelled north of, and even less have returned. But, what lies to the west is perhaps the most disturbing of all. You are standing on the shore of the Dead Sea. It's black and lifeless waters are perfectly still like a huge mirror of pollished obsidian. It's calm and lack of life chill you to the bone, surely one step into those evil waters would mean your death.

Exit.Description: The Blight continues on to the east.
The Blight continues on to the south.

Room.Description: A grotesque and disturbing site meets you eyes here. The Blight still surrounds you all of it's death and decay strong in your mind. But, what lies to the west is perhaps the most disturbing of all. You are standing on the shore of the Dead Sea. It's black and lifeless waters are perfectly still like a huge mirror of pollished obsidian. It's calm and lack of life chill you to the bone, surely one step into those evil waters would mean your death.
